metadata.title: CVE-2021-47320 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nfs:fix acl memory leak of posix_acl_create() When looking into another nfsxfstests report, I found acl and default_acl in nfs3_proc_create() andnfs3_proc_mknod() error paths are possibly leaked. Fix them in advance.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1111.118~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1108.122~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1080.88~16.04.1').
